hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.immutable

Class ImmutableMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.immutable.ImmutableMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Matrix
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImmutableMatrix2, ImmutableMatrix3, ImmutableVector

    public class ImmutableMatrix
extends Object
implements Matrix
    An immutable matrix implementation.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

        public Matrix getSubmatrix(int row1,
                  int row2,
                  int col1,
                  int col2)
        Description copied from interface: Matrix
        Returns a new matrix that is a submatrix of this one. The result will be a matrix with row2-row1+1 rows and col2-col1+1 columns, and will be initialized with the corresponding values from this matrix.
        Specified by:
        getSubmatrix in interface Matrix

        row2 - the last row of the submatrix

        col2 - the last column of the submatrix

        the submatrix

        public double error(Matrix m)
        Description copied from interface: Matrix
        Returns the 2-norm of the difference of this matrix and the argument. This norm is often used as an error measure between two matrices.

        Parameters:

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Description copied from interface: Matrix
        Scales this matrix by a scalar so that its 2-norm become 1. This method is equivalent to scale(1/norm()).
        Specified by:
        normalize in interface Matrix

        Specified by:
        normalized in interface Matrix
        Returns:
